title: sshfs fails reset by peer
label: [Label(name="cannot reproduce"), Label(name="waiting for response")]
body:
I read #64 #83 #71 but they do not work for me

version 5.10 on fairphone2
symptoms:
sshfs -p 1234 user@192.168.1.131:/storage/emulated/0 ~/mnt/fp2/  
       read: Connection reset by peer
on server; The public key to authenticate can not be read.
there is no public key on /storage/emulated/0/.ssh

in the first attempt the application has stopped.
I have tried with and without public key , and with anonymous login.

How can I find the fault?
may be i have disable file writing?

title: Always hangs when download transfer is nearly finished (ls output without link count)
body: Whenever I start a transfer from Device to PC, it hangs at 85-99%, depending on the size. Every single time. The opposite instead works (PC -> Device). I'd like to solve this problem. I had a look at the logs and nothing evident came to my eyes. My sensation is: transfer is done with buffer blocks, and when the buffer is fully filled, it is transfered regularly. The last block to be transfered will always be partially filled, and this hangs the server (maybe a condition like testing EOF isn't working as expected on my device, maybe another approach can be tested, like comparing transfered size with original filesize). The problem happens also with small files (i.e. size is smaller than transfer block). Contact me if you want me to test some debugging enabled version on my device.

title: update bouncycastle to 1.60
body: bouncycastle (mina sshd uses it) should be updated to most recent version which is 1.60

title: Support for SSHFS
label: [Label(name="cannot reproduce"), Label(name="waiting for response")]
body:
Hi,

it would be really nice to have primitive FTPd extended enough to support SSHFS. Currently mounting is possible, I was also able to create a directory but creating a file, either with `touch file1` or with `echo content > file1` wasn't possible. Writing into an existing file is possible e.g. with `echo content > fileexists` but appending seems to work but actually overwrites the whole content e.g. `echo addtlcontent >> fileexists`. `cp file1 fileexists` works but `mv file1 fileexists` does not work, `mv file1 newfile` (where newfile doesn't exist, i.e. a rename) works though.

SSHFS should be available on any Linux, e.g. on Fedora as fuse-sshfs, or from https://github.com/libfuse/sshfs

All this works with an OpenSSH server running on another Android device, so it's a limitation of the server, not of the SSHFS implementation. There is only one exception: `touch file` complains that it can't set the date, but that's minimal.

Thanks, Eric

title: NullPointerException due to LOST.DIR contents?
Add option to shutdown after some time of idling.
body:
I sometimes forget to disable the FTP server again, which has the side-effect of preventing my screen to turn off after the display timeout.

It would be a nice option to be able to auto-shutdown the server after some time without connections.

This also is a security plus, in case the server is anonymous or has a weak password.

title: Files modification time as create time, expect it as original modification time.
body:
Hi. I'm using some software to sync all my files on most of my devices. (such as Freefilesync, Beyond Compare)
It detect files modification time to check if a file has been edited.

I want to use prim-ftpd to make my android devices to be a sftp-server, but I find out when I copy a file from my computer to my phone through sftp, the files modification time is as its create time(aka now), not the original modification time, that causes Freefilesync thinks it's a new version of file.

Can you fix it?

Android version: 4.4
prim-ftpd version: 5.8

title: Feature request: add pause/restart button in notification
body:
Would it not be useful if there was a button in the notification that allow to pause and restart the server quickly without reopening the application?
For those like me who use the start at boot function, have the server always active and often change wifi network it would be useful to be able to pause and restart the service quickly.

Thank you

title: Feature request: make lockout options configurable
body:
Apparently Primitive FTPd locks out an ip address temporarily after 3 failed login attempts. But neither the number of failed attempts before banning nor the length of time for the ban is user-configurable. This is really frustrating when you're just using it on the LAN to transfer files between the phone and desktop, but you start getting "connection refused" messages inexplicably.

Also, I tried turning on the log to a text file, but the name and location of the text file is not stated nor configurable, so I couldn't find it. Please make this configurable.

title: HTTP Server
body:
When trying to access an address like http://192.168.1.103:12345/ and instead the page never finishes loading or shows this error:
```
220 Service ready for new user.
530 Access denied.
530 Access denied.
530 Access denied.
530 Access denied.
530 Access denied.
```
I think it could be used to add an HTTP server in the application. It would be enough for it to be something similar to [SimpleHTTPServer](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=jp.ubi.common.http.server) and in terms of which library to use or how to implement such functionality, [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/6329468/how-to-create-a-http-server-in-android) could be a good starting point.
I suggest this because Chrome (and probably most of its forks) do not support FTP protocol and therefore only work in Firefox (or some Gecko based browsers), which greatly limits at the users who are just looking for a simple/quick way to share files.

body:
feature request:
I'm using your beautiful tool as a hack to modify the sdcard from the termux command line and would like to set the server to only talk to 127.0.0.1
I can easilly imagine use cases where you would only want the server to talk to 192.168.* or block somewhere known for its hackers.

thank you for listening
and more generally thank you for a great tool.

title: Notification showing server IP/Port
body:
Hey there,
I love the ability to start a server from a quicktile, but since I change wifi networks a lot, I still end up having to open the app each time to check what the server IP is so I can type it into my client. Would you consider adding an option to display a notification with the server IP/port while the server is switched on?

Or failing that, maybe change the text below the quicktile from 'pFTPD Runnning ..." to the IP/Port combo when the server is turned on? Or perhaps even a quicktile long-press action which would show a popup with the IP/Port.

Basically anything to avoid having to open the app each time would be absolutely wonderful! Thanks!

title: // java.lang.NumberFormatException: Invalid int: ""
primitive ftpd is affected by a bug on certain Custom ROMs
body:
Hello,
using a Samsung Galaxy Grand DUOS GT-I9082 running LineageOS 13.0 6.0.1_r79 from July 2017 I discovered that "primitive ftpd" is affected by the bug treated in the following links. In those links you can see that the whole problem is fixed on recent Custom ROMs. Trouble is that a lot of devices are stuck on older ROM releases so "primitive ftpd" development should do the necessary steps to avoid it like the developers on the app "Conversations" did (look at the last link).

https://issuetracker.google.com/issues/64434571

https://jira.lineageos.org/browse/BUGBASH-1052

https://gitlab.com/fdroid/fdroiddata/issues/979

https://github.com/siacs/Conversations/issues/2785

Thanks and greetings!

title: Can't access filesystem as root (config option for path to busybox)
body:
I'm using primitive ftpd on a rooted Marshmallow TV box
When I access sftp (or ftp) using Plain old filesystem, I access /storage/emulated/0 correctly. But when I use Root mode, I can't access anything.
I had a look to supersu log and what I think is causing my issue is this:

title: Expected ssh pubkey format in KeyParser.java is too strict
body:
In versions after 4.5, I wasn't able to use ssh pubkeys anymore. The error message said that the key could not be read. 
Today I decided to have a look at the code and found out that you are expecting a very strict key format in https://github.com/wolpi/prim-ftpd/blob/f82dcfee433537a90a9316753a327b136314d29b/pftpd-pojo-lib/src/main/java/org/primftpd/pojo/KeyParser.java#L71
I expects exactly three parts, separated by space. But an ssh pubkey can have a comment containing several spaces. Mine did, this check failed and the misleading error was, that it could not be read. 
In my opinion the check should be `if (parts.length >= 2)`.

title: Upgrade apache mina libraries

title: Show SHA256 fingerprint base64 encoded
body: OpenSSH shows SHA256 fingerprints in this format: `SHA256:x4xld/tPdeOhbyJcTOxd+IbSZ4OpnBzh/IskocyrOM` but prim-ftpd uses hexadecimal. Please allow to show the SHA256 fingerprint in the OpenSSH format.

title: Update the homescreen widget background to be much nicer.
Minor features and improvements
body:
Following on from #58, features include:
- Improving the homescreen widget presentation.
- Anonymous login support.
- Ability to stop the server directly from the notification bar.
- Launch the main activity directly from the widget if a password is required.
- Using event bus to trigger a page refresh without necessarily having to rely on passing the MenuItem objects around.

title: Support for pull-requests for new features?
body:
I found your project while looking to implement my own FTP client and thought it was interesting enough to expand on.

I ended up playing around with it and adding small features here and there. But I wasn't sure if you were interested in merging features/pull-requests.

The features I implemented include:
- Anonymous FTP user support - it's a hassle to force a password unto the user. Toggle-able of-course.
- Expanded notification layout - so that you can expand it to stop/pause the server(s) without having to go to the activity screen.
- Included state-specific background colours (green and red) on the home screen widget as the current transparent background and white text makes it difficult to view on the homescreen.

If you're open to pull-requests, where do you stand on additional libraries?
Also, do you prefer including the raw jar libraries over the standard gradle dependency block:

```
dependencies {
    //compile fileTree(dir: 'libs', include: ['*.jar'])
    compile 'org.apache.ftpserver:ftpserver-core:1.0.6'
    compile 'org.apache.ftpserver:ftplet-api:1.0.6'
    compile 'org.slf4j:slf4j-api:1.7.13'
    compile 'org.slf4j:slf4j-simple:1.7.13'
    compile 'org.apache.mina:mina-core:2.0.10'
    compile 'org.apache.sshd:sshd-core:0.13.0'
    compile 'com.sshtools:j2ssh-maverick:1.5.2'
    compile 'org.slf4j:slf4j-android:1.6.1-RC1'
}
```

If so, why? I'd really like to know.

The library I propose to include is the lightweight [eventbus](https://github.com/greenrobot/EventBus) library to make updating the launcher widget and activity screen state easier rather than making using the static method call.
I'd also like to include the LeakCanary library to help fix any potential memory leaks.

Regards.

Status:    Connecting to 10.42.0.55:1234...

title: Problem with FTP file upload on KDE
body:
When I use KDE and upload a file, the default setting is to add ".part" at the end of the file and when the transfer is finished the file is renamed to it's original file name. This isn't working for whatever reason and the final rename fails, so the file transfer finishes with the ".part" extension. Hopefully this can be fixed.

My actual (disliked) workaround is: http://www.krusader.org/documentation/faq_usage.html#id2672746

> ###### How do not add .part suffix when copying files via FTP?
> 
> When uploading files a .part suffix is added to the filename, once the upload is complete the filename is renamed automagically to remove the .part suffix. This works great but sometimes some FTP servers do not allow a rename operation. You can solve this by unchecking the checkbox Mark partially uploaded files in KDE's System Settings. The check box is located at Network Settings → Connection Preferences.

title: dns-sd: should be _sftp-ssh._tcp
body:
prim-ftpd announces its sftp server as _sftp._tcp on dns-sd (zeroconf/bonjour), while it should use _sftp-ssh._tcp according to http://www.dns-sd.org/servicetypes.html ; that would make the server show up in the "network neighborhood" of gvfs (used by gnome, xfce and others).

please consider changing the announced service type, or (if there are good reasons to use _sftp._tcp) announcing both.

title: App crash on file rename when connected with FTP
body: When I try to rename a file while connected via FTP, primitive ftpd crashes.

title: 1x1 widget to start/stop server
body: the title says it all :wink:

title: android 5 sd-card support
body:
Android 5 introduced a new API to access sd-cards. It is called "Storage Access Framework" (SAF):

https://developer.android.com/guide/topics/providers/document-provider.html

I intend to create a new section in main activity to list storage devices and display whether permission to access it has been asked. It would provide an icon to request that permission.

The Filesystem Adapters for both servers would need a new implementation that don't use java.io.File but SAF primitives.

As SAF does not work with file path but with content URIs I think it is necessary to keep an internal mapping file beteween paths and URIs.

title: Support for SSH public key authentication
body: SSH keyboard-interactive authentication is inconvenient when using SFTP in automounting situations. Please consider adding support for public key authentication against the server. An authorized_keys file could be placed in .ssh/authorized_keys in the home directory, explicitly loaded into the application, or copy-pasted into a text area there. (For starters, any of these would do; I'm not sure which gives the most Android-like user experience).

title: primitive ftpd should use switches instead of checkboxes in the settings to adhere to Google Material Design Guidelines

Currently primitive ftpd is using checkboxes in the settings.

But the Google Material Design Guidelines clearly say:

> https://www.google.com/design/spec/components/selection-controls.html
> 
> [...] If you have a single option, avoid using a checkbox and use an on/off switch instead. [...]

So, could you please replace them with switches?

Regards

title: Please add an "About" section
body:
Hello,

would there be any chance you could add an "About" section to primitve ftpd which shows the version number and so on?

Maybe it could be placed at the bottom of the preferences?

Regards

title: Port 21 for FTP and port 22 for SFTP do not work
body:
Hello,

as far as I understand, the standard port for FTP is port 21 and the standard port for SFTP is port 22.

However, when I try to configure those ports in primitive ftpd, primitive ftpd throws the following error message:

"Port value is invalid. Resetting it to default."

Tested on LG G2 running latest LG stock ROM (Android 5.0.2 Lollipop).

Why is it doing this?

Regards

title: Icon on main screen toolbar?
body:
Hello,

I noticed that on the [Google Play Store screenshots](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=org.primftpd), the primitive ftpd main screen toolbar shows the primitive ftpd icon, see:

![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7558360/8765313/93167cbe-2e06-11e5-97e2-9bcd26790699.png)

However, I have primitive ftpd installed and it does not show the icon on the main screen toolbar.

Tested on LG G2 running latest LG stock ROM (Android 5.0.2 Lollipop).

I'm just wondering:

Is this normal (i.e. the Google Play Store simply shows some older screenshots)?

Or is it a bug?

Regards

title: Typos in "Prevent Standby" option description
body:
Hello,

the description of the "Prevent Standby" option has some typos:

It says "uplodas". Should be changed to "uploads",

It also says "dwonloads". Should be changed to "downloads".

Regards

title: Please add a light theme
body:
Hello,

currently primitive ftpd only has a dark theme.

Would there be any chance you could also add a light theme?

It would be much appreciated.

Regards

title: Main screen looks cluttered
body:
Hello @wolpi ,

thank you for this great open source app.

It's really useful.

But the main screen looks quite cluttered, because:

It's basically full of text. There is no bold font for the headlines and almost no space between the sections.

I have made a mock-up for an improvement. I'm not really a professional designer at the moment, so I made it with LibreOffice Writer :laughing:. Anyway, here is what it looks like (please also see the notes below the images):

**Server(s) stopped:**

![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7558360/8765191/6d561cc2-2e02-11e5-8e1b-8067db338334.png)

**Server(s) running:**

![Image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7558360/8765201/82c59e84-2e02-11e5-9fe0-03a7639b78b8.png)

Notes about this mock-up:
- Toolbar: The start (play) button has been removed and has been moved from the toolbar to the mainscreen (see below). Also the settings icon has been changed from a wrench icon to a gear icon. 
- The start/stop button is now on the main screen. It says "Start server(s)" when the servers are stopped and says "Stop server(s)" when the servers are running.
- The "Running server(s)" section says "None (Press start button to run)" when no server is running. And when server(s) are running it only shows the servers which are actually running. Currently primitive ftpd even shows servers which are not running. IMHO it should only show servers which are running. The port of each server is shown in brackets, so, for example "SFTP (Port 22)".
- The "Username" section shows the username.
- The "Host IPs" section shows the hosts IPs. To save space and to make it look more tidy, it simply lists the IPs and mentions the network interfaces in brackets.
- The "Key fingerprints" section shows four buttons. The "(Re-Generate)" button does (re-)generate the key fingerprints. The "Show MD5" button would open a pop-up which shows the MD5. The "Show SHA1" button would open a pop-up which shows the SHA1. The "Show SHA256" button would open a pop-up which shows the SHA256.

Yeah, that's it.

IMHO it looks much more tidy and cleaner like this.

Any chance you could change primitive ftpd to look more like this?

It would be much appreciated.

Regards

title: keepass error
label: [Label(name="upstream library")]
body: Took me a while, but I managed to trace down why I could not get keepass (http://keepass.info/) to sync to my tablet via ftp. This ftpd, https://f-droid.org/repository/browse/?fdfilter=ftp&fdid=be.ppareit.swiftp_free , works ok. But not this one, using ngrep, it halts just after getting data from issuing a MDTM comamnd. Keepass throws up a very UN-helpful error message, "Operation not valid due to the current state of the object". Googling show many causes of that error.

title: SFTP does not start
body:
I tried v3.0 from f-droid.org on Android 4.4.2 and only FTP starts.
The OS is rooted and other services like Samba work fine.
I only need sftp, can you please fix it?

title: Thank you
body:
Didn't say thanks, issue solved thanks!
This SFTP server is perfect.

title: Material Design
body:
It is planned to update the design to material? This would be very nice
Thanks for your work!

title: Here is the french translation
body: I've also changed the way the preference activity close.

title: Usefull options for daily use and battery life
body:
If you find the following changes usefull, please take them over so that they are reflected in F-Droid.
Thank you and Merry Christmas.

added autostart option to automatically start the server during bootup
added wifi mode, which will only bind to a local wifi/wlan ip address
instead of all possible (and even global) addresses
changed behaving of notification bar (sticky)
changed behaving of server in wifi mode, server now shuts down and lets
device deep sleep if no wifi is available
changed wake lock from screen dim to partial, a wifi lock should be
aquired if server shuts down but needs to stay on

title: Cannot transfer directories with all files included
label: [Label(name="enhancement")]
body:
Hi wolpi

First of all my thank you for your wonderful app. I like it a lot and use it on a daily basis. Clean and small and doing what it should do! :-)

There is one enhancement or bug issue (do not know how to classify) I would like to report. Your primitive ftp is not able to transfer directories with files included. I always first have to create the directories on my smartphone before I can transfer all files to the appropriate directories. Other ftp servers let me transfer everything at once and if sub directories do not exist it will automatically create these. Can you look into this? Thanks

skx7
